context: In the planning of a new district in a township, it was decided to build a special community in the southeast, northwest, centered on the citizen park.These four communities are designated as cultural area, leisure area, commercial area and administrative service area.It is known that the administrative service area is southwest of the cultural area, and the cultural area is southeast of the leisure area.
question: Based on the above statement, which of the following can be derived?
options: A.Civic Park is north of the administrative service area
B.The leisure area is southwest of the cultural area
C.The cultural district is in the northeast of the business district
D.The business district is southeast of the leisure area
raw_logic_programs:
# Declarations
areas = EnumSort([cultural_area, leisure_area, commercial_area, administrative_service_area])
position = Function([areas] -> [int, int])  # Position represented as (x, y) coordinates

# Constraints
position(cultural_area) == (x1, y1) ::: Position of cultural area
position(leisure_area) == (x2, y2) ::: Position of leisure area
position(administrative_service_area) == (x3, y3) ::: Position of administrative service area
position(commercial_area) == (x4, y4) ::: Position of commercial area

And(x3 < x1, y3 > y1) ::: Administrative service area is southwest of the cultural area
And(x1 < x2, y1 > y2) ::: Cultural area is southeast of the leisure area

# Options
Question ::: Based on the above statement, which of the following can be derived?
is_valid(position(civic_park) == (x3, y3 + 1)) ::: (A) Civic Park is north of the administrative service area
is_valid(position(leisure_area) == (x1 - 1, y1)) ::: (B) The leisure area is southwest of the cultural area
is_valid(position(cultural_area) == (x4 + 1, y4)) ::: (C) The cultural district is in the northeast of the business district
is_valid(position(commercial_area) == (x2 + 1, y2 - 1)) ::: (D) The business district is southeast of the leisure area

context: The company sent three young staff members to the South for business trip.The three of them happened to be sitting in a row.At least one of the two people sitting on the right side of 24 years old was 20 years old.20 years old.At least one of the two people sitting on the left of the accountant is a salesperson, and one of the two people sitting on the right of the salesperson is also a salesperson.
question: So what are the three young people on business?
options: A.20-year-old accountant, 20-year-old salesperson, 24-year-old salesperson
B.20-year-old accountant, 24-year-old salesperson, 24-year-old salesperson
C.24-year-old accountant, 20-year-old salesperson, 20-year-old salesperson
D.20-year-old accountant, 20-year-old accountant, 24-year-old salesperson
raw_logic_programs:
# Declarations
staff_members = EnumSort([Person1, Person2, Person3])
ages = EnumSort([20, 24])
roles = EnumSort([accountant, salesperson])
sits = Function([staff_members] -> [int])  # Position in the row (1, 2, or 3)
age_of = Function([staff_members] -> [ages])
role_of = Function([staff_members] -> [roles])

# Constraints
ForAll([p:staff_members], Or(age_of(p) == 20, age_of(p) == 24)) ::: Each staff member is either 20 or 24 years old
Exists([p1:staff_members, p2:staff_members], And(sits(p1) == 2, age_of(p1) == 24, Or(age_of(p2) == 20))) ::: At least one of the two people sitting on the right side of the 24-year-old is 20 years old
Exists([p1:staff_members, p2:staff_members], And(sits(p1) == 1, role_of(p1) == accountant, Or(role_of(p2) == salesperson))) ::: At least one of the two people sitting on the left of the accountant is a salesperson
Exists([p1:staff_members, p2:staff_members], And(role_of(p1) == salesperson, Or(role_of(p2) == salesperson))) ::: One of the two people sitting on the right of the salesperson is also a salesperson

# Options
Question ::: What are the three young people on business?
is_valid(And(age_of(Person1) == 20, role_of(Person1) == accountant, age_of(Person2) == 20, role_of(Person2) == salesperson, age_of(Person3) == 24, role_of(Person3) == salesperson)) ::: (A)
is_valid(And(age_of(Person1) == 20, role_of(Person1) == accountant, age_of(Person2) == 24, role_of(Person2) == salesperson, age_of(Person3) == 24, role_of(Person3) == salesperson)) ::: (B)
is_valid(And(age_of(Person1) == 24, role_of(Person1) == accountant, age_of(Person2) == 20, role_of(Person2) == salesperson, age_of(Person3) == 20, role_of(Person3) == salesperson)) ::: (C)
is_valid(And(age_of(Person1) == 20, role_of(Person1) == accountant, age_of(Person2) == 20, role_of(Person2) == accountant, age_of(Person3) == 24, role_of(Person3) == salesperson)) ::: (D)

context: In recent years, graduate entrance examinations have continued to heat up.Correspondingly, a variety of postgraduate counseling classes have emerged, especially English and political counseling classes are almost a must for the postgraduates.Xiaozhuang, who has just started working, also intends to take the postgraduate entrance exam, so Xiaozhuang must take English tutoring classes
question: Which of the following can best strengthen the above argument
options: A.If you take an English tutoring class, you can pass the graduate entrance exam
B.Only those who intend to take the graduate entrance exam will participate in the English tutoring class
C.Even if you take an English tutoring class, you may not be able to pass the graduate entrance exam
D.If you do not participate in the English tutoring class, you cannot pass the graduate entrance exam
raw_logic_programs:
# Declarations
students = EnumSort([Xiaozhuang])
classes = EnumSort([English, Political])
takes = Function([students] -> [classes])

# Constraints
takes(Xiaozhuang) == English ::: Xiaozhuang must take English tutoring classes

# Options
Question ::: Which of the following can best strengthen the above argument?
is_strong(Implies(takes(Xiaozhuang) == English, passes(Xiaozhuang))) ::: (A)
is_strong(ForAll([s:students], Implies(takes(s) == English, intends_to_take_graduate_exam(s)))) ::: (B)
is_weak(Implies(takes(Xiaozhuang) == English, passes(Xiaozhuang))) ::: (C)
is_weak(Implies(Not(takes(Xiaozhuang) == English), Not(passes(Xiaozhuang)))) ::: (D)

context: A unit conducted the year-end assessment and after democratic voting, five people were identified as candidates for the first prize.In the selection of five in four, the following factors need to be considered? 1) At least one person of Bingding is selected.2) If E is selected, then A and B are also selected.3) A maximum of 2 people are selected.
question: According to the above statement, it can be concluded that who is not in the fourth?
options: A.A.
B.B.
C.C.
D.Ding.
raw_logic_programs:

candidates = EnumSort([A, B, C, Ding, E])
selected = Function([candidates] -> [bool])

# Constraints
Count([c:candidates], selected(c)) >= 1 ::: At least one person of Bingding is selected.
Implies(selected(E), And(selected(A), selected(B))) ::: If E is selected, then A and B are also selected.
Count([c:candidates], selected(c)) <= 2 ::: A maximum of 2 people are selected.

# Options
Question ::: According to the above statement, it can be concluded that who is not in the fourth?
is_unsat(selected(A)) ::: (A)
is_unsat(selected(B)) ::: (B)

context: Zhang Ming, Li Ying, Wang Jia and Chen Rui work in a team.They come from four provinces of Jiangsu, Anhui, Fujian and Shandong.Each person can only speak a dialect of their origin.Speaking of southern Fujian dialects, Shandong people have the highest educational level and can speak Central Plains Mandarin.Wang Jia has a lower education level than Fujianese.Li Ying can speak Huizhou dialect and is a colleague with his classmates from Jiangsu.Chen Rui does not understand the dialect of southern Fujian.
question: According to the above statement, you can get which of the following?
options: A Chen Rui can't speak the Central Plains Mandarin
B Zhang Ming speaks Minnan dialect
C Li Ying is from Shandong
D Wang Jia can speak Huizhou dialect
raw_logic_programs:
# Declarations
people = EnumSort([Zhang_Ming, Li_Ying, Wang_Jia, Chen_Rui])
provinces = EnumSort([Jiangsu, Anhui, Fujian, Shandong])
dialects = EnumSort([Minnan, Huizhou, Central_Plains_Mandarin])
speaks = Function([people] -> [dialects])
from_province = Function([people] -> [provinces])
education_level = Function([people] -> [int])  # Higher number indicates higher education level

# Constraints
ForAll([p:people], speaks(p) == speaks(from_province(p))) ::: Each person can only speak a dialect of their origin
education_level(Shandong) > education_level(Fujian) ::: Shandong people have the highest educational level
speaks(Shandong) == Central_Plains_Mandarin ::: Shandong people can speak Central Plains Mandarin
education_level(Wang_Jia) < education_level(Fujian) ::: Wang Jia has a lower education level than Fujianese
speaks(Li_Ying) == Huizhou ::: Li Ying can speak Huizhou dialect
from_province(Li_Ying) == Jiangsu ::: Li Ying is a colleague with his classmates from Jiangsu
Not(speaks(Chen_Rui) == Minnan) ::: Chen Rui does not understand the dialect of southern Fujian

# Options
Question ::: According to the above statement, you can get which of the following?
is_valid(Not(speaks(Chen_Rui) == Central_Plains_Mandarin)) ::: (A)
is_valid(speaks(Zhang_Ming) == Minnan) ::: (B)
is_valid(from_province(Li_Ying) == Shandong) ::: (C)
is_valid(speaks(Wang_Jia) == Huizhou) ::: (D)

context: The person in charge of the relevant department said that pilots will be carried out in some areas this year to prepare for the system and policy preparations for the comprehensive clean-up of 'small property houses', and require all localities to confirm the registration and certification of rural collective land.All small-property houses are not subject to registration and are not protected by law.Therefore, this newly built house in Hexi Village is not protected by law.
question: Which of the following is true will most weaken the above argument
options: A.This newly built house in Hexi Village has been tacitly approved by relevant departments
B.This newly built house in Hexi Village is a small property house
C.This newly built house in Hexi Village is built on rural collective land
D.Some of the newly built houses in Hexi Village are not small property houses
raw_logic_programs:
To formulate the given problem as a logic program, we will follow the structure of Declarations, Constraints, and Options.

### Problem:
The person in charge of the relevant department said that pilots will be carried out in some areas this year to prepare for the system and policy preparations for the comprehensive clean-up of 'small property houses', and require all localities to confirm the registration and certification of rural collective land. All small-property houses are not subject to registration and are not protected by law. Therefore, this newly built house in Hexi Village is not protected by law.

### Question:
Which of the following is true will most weaken the above argument?

### Choices:
(A) This newly built house in Hexi Village has been tacitly approved by relevant departments  
(B) This newly built house in Hexi Village is a small property house  
(C) This newly built house in Hexi Village is built on rural collective land  
(D) Some of the newly built houses in Hexi Village are not small property houses  

### Logic Program

#### Declarations
``` 
houses = EnumSort([newly_built_house_Hexi, small_property_house])
status = EnumSort([protected, not_protected])
approved = Function([houses] -> [bool])
registered = Function([houses] -> [bool])
protection_status = Function([houses] -> [status])
```

#### Constraints
```
ForAll([h:houses], Implies(approved(h), protection_status(h) == protected)) ::: If a house is approved, it is protected
ForAll([h:houses], Implies(h == small_property_house, protection_status(h) == not_protected)) ::: All small-property houses are not protected by law
protection_status(newly_built_house_Hexi) == not_protected ::: The newly built house in Hexi Village is not protected by law
```

#### Options
```
Question ::: Which of the following is true will most weaken the above argument?
is_valid(approved(newly_built_house_Hexi)) ::: (A) This newly built house in Hexi Village has been tacitly approved by relevant departments
is_valid(houses == small_property_house) ::: (B) This newly built house in Hexi Village is a small property house
is_valid(registered(newly_built_house_Hexi) == true) ::: (C) This newly built house in Hexi Village is built on rural collective land
is_valid(Exists([h:houses], And(h == newly_built_house_Hexi, protection_status(h) == not_protected))) ::: (D) Some of the newly built houses in Hexi Village are not small property houses
```

### Summary
This logic program captures the relationships and constraints regarding the newly built house in Hexi Village and the concept of small property houses. The options represent statements that could potentially weaken the argument that the newly built house is not protected by law.

context: There are five teams participating in the game.The audience had the following comments on the results? (1) The champion is either the Shannan team or the Jiangbei team.(2) The champion is neither Shanbei nor Jiangnan.(3) The champion is Jiangnan Team.(4) The champion is not the Shannan team.
question: The result of the match showed that only one argument was correct, so who won the championship?
options: A Shannan
B Jiangnan
C Shanbei
D Jiangbei
raw_logic_programs:
# Declarations
teams = EnumSort([Shannan, Jiangbei, Shanbei, Jiangnan])
champion = Function([] -> [teams])

# Constraints
Count([c:teams], champion() == c) == 1 ::: only one team can be the champion
Or(champion() == Shannan, champion() == Jiangbei) ::: The champion is either the Shannan team or the Jiangbei team.
Not(Or(champion() == Shanbei, champion() == Jiangnan)) ::: The champion is neither Shanbei nor Jiangnan.
champion() == Jiangnan ::: The champion is Jiangnan Team.
Not(champion() == Shannan) ::: The champion is not the Shannan team.

# Options
Question ::: Who won the championship?
is_valid(champion() == Shannan) ::: (A)
is_valid(champion() == Jiangnan) ::: (B)
is_valid(champion() == Shanbei) ::: (C)
is_valid(champion() == Jiangbei) ::: (D)

context: Compared with small and medium-sized cities, especially small cities and towns, large cities have higher living costs, which inevitably limits the entry of rural population.Therefore, the development of large cities alone cannot actually achieve urbanization
question: Which of the following is the conclusion must be assumed
options: A.Urbanization is the only way for China's development
B.Simple development of large cities is not conducive to the promotion of urbanization
C.To achieve urbanization, the city must fully absorb the rural population
D.The attractiveness of large cities to the rural population in the outside world is significantly lower than that of small and medium-sized cities
raw_logic_programs:
# Declarations
cities = EnumSort([small, medium, large])
living_costs = Function([cities] -> [bool])
urbanization = Function([cities] -> [bool])
rural_population_entry = Function([cities] -> [bool])

# Constraints
living_costs(large) == true ::: large cities have higher living costs
living_costs(small) == false ::: small cities have lower living costs
living_costs(medium) == false ::: medium cities have lower living costs
urbanization(large) == false ::: development of large cities alone cannot achieve urbanization
ForAll([c:cities], Implies(living_costs(c), Not(rural_population_entry(c)))) ::: higher living costs limit the entry of rural population

# Options
Question ::: Which of the following is the conclusion must be assumed?
is_assumed(urbanization(medium) == true) ::: (A) Urbanization is the only way for China's development
is_assumed(Not(urbanization(large))) ::: (B) Simple development of large cities is not conducive to the promotion of urbanization
is_assumed(rural_population_entry(large) == false) ::: (C) To achieve urbanization, the city must fully absorb the rural population
is_assumed(living_costs(large) < living_costs(medium)) ::: (D) The attractiveness of large cities to the rural population in the outside world is significantly lower than that of small and medium-sized cities

context: Researchers recently discovered that there is an area called the thalamus pillow deep in the human brain, which is like an information desk operator, responsible for sorting out the external stimulus information and focusing human attention on the most important for behavior and survival Information.The researchers pointed out that this discovery is expected to bring new treatments for disorders such as attention deficit hyperactivity disorder and schizophrenia caused by lack of attention.
question: Which of the following is assumed by the above argument
options: A.Some schizophrenia are not caused by lack of attention
B.Visual information is only transmitted through the visual cortex to obtain a neural network to transmit
C.Researchers have developed a new technology that can directly track the communication between the nerve cortex in the visual cortex and thalamus occipital region
D.The brain cannot process too much information in detail at the same time, and will only selectively focus on the things most relevant to the behavior
raw_logic_programs:
# Declarations
disorders = EnumSort([ADHD, schizophrenia])
functions = EnumSort([thalamus_pillow, information_sorting, attention_focus])
causes = Function([disorders] -> [bool])
responsible = Function([functions] -> [bool])

# Constraints
responsible(thalamus_pillow) == true ::: The thalamus pillow is responsible for sorting out external stimulus information and focusing attention
ForAll([d:disorders], Implies(causes(d), responsible(thalamus_pillow))) ::: If a disorder is caused by lack of attention, it is related to the thalamus pillow
causes(ADHD) == true ::: ADHD is caused by lack of attention
causes(schizophrenia) == true ::: Schizophrenia is caused by lack of attention

# Options
Question ::: Which of the following is assumed by the above argument?
is_assumed(ForAll([d:disorders], Implies(causes(d), responsible(thalamus_pillow)))) ::: (A)
is_assumed(False) ::: (B)
is_assumed(False) ::: (C)
is_assumed(True) ::: (D)

is_valid(supports(C)) ::: (C)
is_valid(supports(D)) ::: (D)

context: A research report shows that the proportion of children of cadres in Peking University increased from 20% in the 1980s to nearly 40% in 1977, surpassing the children of workers, farmers and professional technicians, and becoming the largest source of students.According to this, some media believe that the proportion of students and children of Peking University students has been rising for 20 years, surpassing other classes.
question: Which one, if true, most doubts the views of the above media
options: A.Many of the cadres counted in the past 20 years are enterprise cadres, which used to include only government officials
B.Compared with foreign countries, Chinese education provides workers and peasants with more opportunities for education and social mobility
C.After the founding of New China, more and more children of workers and peasants entered the university
D.Some of the workers 'children in the statistics may be former farmers' children
raw_logic_programs:
# Declarations
proportions = EnumSort([children_of_cadres, children_of_workers, children_of_farmers, children_of_professional_technicians])
years = EnumSort([1980s, 1977])
increase = Function([proportions, years] -> [bool])

# Constraints
increase(children_of_cadres, 1980s) == (20 / 100) ::: proportion of children of cadres in the 1980s
increase(children_of_cadres, 1977) == (40 / 100) ::: proportion of children of cadres in 1977
increase(children_of_workers, 1980s) < increase(children_of_cadres, 1980s) ::: children of workers are less than children of cadres in the 1980s
increase(children_of_farmers, 1980s) < increase(children_of_cadres, 1980s) ::: children of farmers are less than children of cadres in the 1980s
increase(children_of_professional_technicians, 1980s) < increase(children_of_cadres, 1980s) ::: children of professional technicians are less than children of cadres in the 1980s

Question ::: Which one, if true, most doubts the views of the above media?
is_doubtful(increase(children_of_cadres, 1980s) == (20 / 100) && increase(children_of_cadres, 1977) == (40 / 100) && increase(children_of_workers, 1980s) < increase(children_of_cadres, 1980s)) ::: (A)
is_doubtful(increase(children_of_workers, 1980s) > increase(children_of_cadres, 1980s)) ::: (B)
is_doubtful(increase(children_of_workers, 1980s) < increase(children_of_cadres, 1980s) && increase(children_of_workers, 1980s) < increase(children_of_farmers, 1980s)) ::: (C)
is_doubtful(increase(children_of_workers, 1980s) < increase(children_of_cadres, 1980s) && increase(children_of_farmers, 1980s) < increase(children_of_professional_technicians, 1980s)) ::: (D)

context: Lotus leaf is the leaf of the aquatic herbaceous plant for many years.Its chemical components mainly include lotus alkaloid, citric acid, malic acid, gluconic acid, oxalic acid, succinic acid, and other basic components against mitosis.Lotus leaf contains a variety of alkaloids, brassin glycosides, lotus leaf glycosides and other ingredients, can effectively reduce cholesterol and triglycerides, has a good effect on hyperlipidemia and obese patients.Lotus leaf infusion and decoction can expand blood vessels, clear heat and relieve heat, and lower blood pressure.Some experts pointed out that lotus leaf is a good medicine for weight loss.Which of the following
question: If it is true, can it most support the opinions of the above experts?
options: A.Lotus leaf promotes gastrointestinal motility and clears the body of stool;
B.Lotus leaf tea is a food, not a medicine, which has the advantages of non-toxicity and safety;
C.Lotus leaf tea becomes a liquid food after soaking in water, and is quickly absorbed in the stomach for a short time, with higher concentration and greater irritation.
D.After taking lotus leaf products, a layer of fat isolation film is formed on the human intestinal wall, which can effectively prevent the absorption of fat;
raw_logic_programs:
# Declarations
components = EnumSort([lotus_alkaloid, citric_acid, malic_acid, gluconic_acid, oxalic_acid, succinic_acid])
effects = EnumSort([reduce_cholesterol, reduce_triglycerides, lower_blood_pressure, promote_weight_loss])
supports = Function([components] -> [effects])

# Constraints
ForAll([c:components], Or(supports(c) == reduce_cholesterol, supports(c) == reduce_triglycerides, supports(c) == lower_blood_pressure, supports(c) == promote_weight_loss)) ::: Lotus leaf contains a variety of components that can effectively reduce cholesterol and triglycerides, and has a good effect on hyperlipidemia and obesity.
ForAll([c:components], Implies(supports(c) == promote_weight_loss, supports(c) == reduce_cholesterol)) ::: If lotus leaf is a good medicine for weight loss, it should also help in reducing cholesterol.

# Options
Question ::: If it is true, can it most support the opinions of the above experts?
is_supportive(supports(lotus_leaf) == promote_weight_loss) ::: (A) Lotus leaf promotes gastrointestinal motility and clears the body of stool;
is_supportive(supports(lotus_leaf_tea) == non_toxic) ::: (B) Lotus leaf tea is a food, not a medicine, which has the advantages of non-toxicity and safety;
is_supportive(supports(lotus_leaf_tea) == quick_absorption) ::: (C) Lotus leaf tea becomes a liquid food after soaking in water, and is quickly absorbed in the stomach for a short time, with higher concentration and greater irritation.
is_supportive(supports(lotus_leaf_products) == fat_absorption_prevention) ::: (D) After taking lotus leaf products, a layer of fat isolation film is formed on the human intestinal wall, which can effectively prevent the absorption of fat;

context: On August 3, 2003, a 'human fossil of 110,000 years ago' was unearthed from the Zhangkoudong ancient human site in Jiuxiang, Yiliang County.The announcement of this excavation immediately attracted wide attention from the media and experts.Many experts who participated in the excavation believe that the appearance of this human tooth fossil indicates that Zhangkoudong had human activities as early as 110,000 years ago.It will rewrite the Kunming area defined by the ancient human ruins of Longtan Mountain in Chenggong County.Mankind has only 30,000 years of history.
question: Which of the following, if true, most doubts the opinions of the above experts?
options: A.Academics are inherently controversial, and everyone has the right to express their opinions;
B.Some experts analyzed the fossil's long axis, crown shape, crown lip and tongue surface protrusion and enamel, etc., that this fossil is not a human incisor fossil, but a deer tooth fossil;
C.This tooth fossil was excavated in the red sand layer 20 cm below the calcium plate 110,000 years ago;
D.Some experts used the uranium method to date the calcium plates of each layer of Zhangkou Cave, and proved that the earliest deposits of the fossil tooth were formed 300,000 years ago;
raw_logic_programs:
# Declarations
fossils = EnumSort([human_fossil, deer_tooth])
experts = EnumSort([expert1, expert2, expert3, expert4])
opinions = Function([experts] -> [bool])

# Constraints
ForAll([e:experts], opinions(e) == true) ::: All experts believe the fossil indicates human activities as early as 110,000 years ago.
exists_human_fossil = Exists([f:fossils], f == human_fossil) ::: There is a belief that the fossil is a human fossil.

# Options

context: In the recruitment examination for the public selection of deputy chiefs in a certain department, a total of 7 people were registered as A.B, C, D, E, G and G.According to statistics, the highest academic qualifications among the 7 people are undergraduate and doctor.Among them there are 3 people who graduated with Ph.D .; 3 women.It is known that? A.B, and C have the same educational level, while G and G have different educational levels; E, G, and G have the same gender, and A and D have different genders.The final appointment was a female doctor.
question: Based on the above statement, which of the following can be derived?
options: A.A is a male doctor;
B.I am a female doctor;
C? Geng is not a male doctor;
D? Ding is a female doctor.
raw_logic_programs:
# Declarations
candidates = EnumSort([A, B, C, D, E, G1, G2])  # G1 and G2 represent the two Gs
educational_levels = EnumSort([undergraduate, doctor])
genders = EnumSort([male, female])
has_degree = Function([candidates] -> [educational_levels])
gender = Function([candidates] -> [genders])

# Constraints
Count([c:candidates], has_degree(c) == doctor) == 3 ::: There are 3 people with a Ph.D.
Count([c:candidates], gender(c) == female) == 3 ::: There are 3 women
has_degree(A) == has_degree(B) == has_degree(C) ::: A, B, and C have the same educational level
has_degree(G1) != has_degree(G2) ::: G1 and G2 have different educational levels
gender(E) == gender(G1) == gender(G2) ::: E, G1, and G2 have the same gender
gender(A) != gender(D) ::: A and D have different genders
Exists([c:candidates], And(gender(c) == female, has_degree(c) == doctor)) ::: The final appointment was a female doctor

# Options
Question ::: Based on the above statement, which of the following can be derived?
is_valid(gender(A) == male, has_degree(A) == doctor) ::: (A) A is a male doctor
is_valid(gender(I) == female, has_degree(I) == doctor) ::: (B) I am a female doctor
is_valid(gender(G1) == female, has_degree(G1) != doctor) ::: (C) Geng is not a male doctor
is_valid(gender(D) == female) ::: (D) Ding is a female doctor

context: There are five stations set up from west to east along a section of the high-speed railway along the river.It is known that Fuyi Station is east of Haoyun Station and West of Huyao Station, and is adjacent to Huyao Station; Jiushang Station is adjacent to Yinling Station.
question: Based on the above information, regarding the order of the five stations from west to east, which of the following is possible?
options: A.Yinling Station, Haoyun Station, Jiushang Station, Fuyi Station, Hu Yao Station;

context: Leeds lived in the middle Jurassic about 165 million years ago.It is a huge fish in the dinosaur era.Leeds can grow up to 9 meters long within 20 years of birth, with an average life span of about 40 years.The largest body length can even reach 16.5 meters.This size is comparable to the largest whale shark in modern times, and the average lifespan of the whale shark is about 70 years, so the growth rate of Leeds is likely to exceed that of the whale shark.
question: Which of the following, if true, can best refute the above argument?
options: A.Leeds fish and whale sharks feed on plankton and small animals in the ocean, and the growth rate cannot be significantly different.
B.Although the lifespan of the Leeds fish and the whale shark differ greatly, they all reach adulthood around the age of 20, and their body shape is basically fixed.
C.Although the lifespan of fish is different, their growth stages basically correspond to their juvenile, adult, middle-aged and elderly
D.There is no obvious change in the growth cycle of Jurassic fish and modern fish
raw_logic_programs:
# Declarations
species = EnumSort([Leeds, whale_shark])
growth_rate = Function([species] -> [float])
lifespan = Function([species] -> [int])
max_length = Function([species] -> [float])
growth_comparison = Function([species, species] -> [bool])

# Constraints
growth_rate(Leeds) > growth_rate(whale_shark) ::: The growth rate of Leeds is likely to exceed that of the whale shark
lifespan(Leeds) == 40 ::: Average lifespan of Leeds is about 40 years
lifespan(whale_shark) == 70 ::: Average lifespan of whale shark is about 70 years
max_length(Leeds) == 16.5 ::: Largest body length of Leeds can reach 16.5 meters
max_length(whale_shark) == 18 ::: Largest body length of whale shark can reach up to 18 meters

# Options
Question ::: Which of the following, if true, can best refute the above argument?
is_refutation(growth_rate(Leeds) == growth_rate(whale_shark)) ::: (A)
is_refutation(lifespan(Leeds) != lifespan(whale_shark) && adulthood_age(Leeds) == adulthood_age(whale_shark)) ::: (B)
is_refutation(growth_stages(Leeds) == growth_stages(whale_shark)) ::: (C)
is_refutation(growth_cycle(Leeds) == growth_cycle(whale_shark)) ::: (D)

context: In 27.3 years, three canoes were continuously excavated on the Huai River beach in Xinyang County, Henan.Among them, in 2010, the first canoe was discovered under the Huaihe River beach in the Zhangzhuang Formation of Xuzhuang Village, Chengjiao Township, Xixian County, which was proved to be one of the earliest and largest canoe in China.The canoe is 9.3 meters long, 0.8 meters wide and 0.6 meters high.According to carbon-14 measurement, the materials for these canoes are exactly the same as the wood produced in tropical regions of Yunnan.This shows that in ancient times more than 3,000 years ago, the climate in Henan was very similar to the tropical climate.The climate on both sides of the middle and lower reaches of the Huaihe River is warm and humid, with tall and dense forests and a wide variety of animals and plants.
question: Which of the following, if true, will best support the above argument?
options: A.The raw materials of these canoes cannot be transported from the distant Yunnan virgin forest, they can only be obtained locally
B.These canoes have been soaked in water for thousands of years and are very heavy
C.The place where the Qi Zhou Qiu Jian story takes place is the Chu area, including south of Xuchang, Henan
D.The canoe hull is pointed at both ends and is chiseled from a complete log for better preservation
raw_logic_programs:
# Declarations
canoes = EnumSort([Canoe1, Canoe2, Canoe3])
materials = EnumSort([wood])
locations = EnumSort([Yunnan, Henan])
climate_conditions = EnumSort([tropical, warm_humid])
supports = Function([canoes] -> [bool])

# Constraints
ForAll([c:canoes], supports(c) == (materials == wood)) ::: The materials for these canoes are exactly the same as the wood produced in tropical regions of Yunnan
ForAll([c:canoes], Implies(supports(c), climate_conditions == tropical)) ::: This shows that in ancient times more than 3,000 years ago, the climate in Henan was very similar to the tropical climate

# Options
Question ::: Which of the following, if true, will best support the above argument?
is_valid(supports(Canoe1) == (materials == wood) && (locations == Yunnan)) ::: (A)
is_valid(supports(Canoe2) == (materials == wood) && (locations == Henan)) ::: (B)
is_valid(supports(Canoe3) == (materials == wood) && (locations == Yunnan)) ::: (C)
is_valid(supports(Canoe1) == (materials == wood) && (climate_conditions == tropical)) ::: (D)

context: In a study, 51 middle school student volunteers were divided into a test group and a control group to receive the same mathematics training.During the five-day training, the researchers used a technique called transcranial random noise stimulation to lightly shock the areas of the brains of 25 test group members that were considered to be related to computing power.The subsequent test results showed that the mathematics ability of the test group members was significantly higher than that of the control group members.To their surprise, the effect of this ability improvement can last at least half a year.The researchers therefore believe that micro-shocks in the brain can improve the brain's computing power.
question: Which of the following, if true, best supports the above researchers 'views?
options: A.This non-invasive stimulus is inexpensive and will not cause any pain to the human body
B.After a slight electric shock to the brain, the blood flow between the neurons in the brain is significantly enhanced, but it returns to normal after multiple stimulations
C.Before the experiment, the mathematics scores of the two groups of students were almost the same
D.Subjects with microshocks in the brain are more concerned about their behavior, and their concentration is more focused during the test
raw_logic_programs:
# Declarations
students = EnumSort([student1, student2, ..., student51])  # 51 middle school students
groups = EnumSort([test_group, control_group])
training = Function([students] -> [groups])
scores = Function([students] -> [int])  # Mathematics scores

# Constraints
Count([s:students], training(s) == test_group) == 25  # 25 students in the test group
Count([s:students], training(s) == control_group) == 26  # 26 students in the control group
ForAll([s:students], scores(s) >= 0)  # Scores are non-negative
ForAll([s:students], Implies(training(s) == test_group, scores(s) > scores(s' where training(s') == control_group))  # Test group scores higher than control group

# Options
Question ::: Which of the following, if true, best supports the above researchers' views?
is_supportive(A) ::: (A) This non-invasive stimulus is inexpensive and will not cause any pain to the human body
is_supportive(B) ::: (B) After a slight electric shock to the brain, the blood flow between the neurons in the brain is significantly enhanced, but it returns to normal after multiple stimulations
is_supportive(C) ::: (C) Before the experiment, the mathematics scores of the two groups of students were almost the same
is_supportive(D) ::: (D) Subjects with microshocks in the brain are more concerned about their behavior, and their concentration is more focused during the test

context: An institution conducted a survey on the average house prices of three types of residential housing in three cities (A.B, and C) in eastern China (these are villas, ordinary commercial houses, and affordable housing from high to low), and the published information includes The following content? according to the price of villa houses, from high to low are A City, B City, and C City; according to the price of ordinary commercial houses, from high to low are A City, B City, and B City; according to affordable housing prices , From high to low are B city, A city, C city.
question: Regarding the overall average price of residential housing in the above three cities, which of the following judgments is wrong?
options: A.The overall average price of residential housing in A City is the highest
B.The overall average price of residential housing in City B is in the middle
C.The overall average price of residential housing in Cingcheng is the lowest

And(prices(A, villas) > prices(B, villas), prices(B, villas) > prices(C, villas)) ::: according to the price of villa houses, from high to low are A City, B City, and C City
And(prices(A, ordinary_commercial_houses) > prices(B, ordinary_commercial_houses), prices(B, ordinary_commercial_houses) > prices(C, ordinary_commercial_houses)) ::: according to the price of ordinary commercial houses, from high to low are A City, B City, and C City

is_unsat(prices(B, villas) + prices(B, ordinary_commercial_houses) + prices(B, affordable_housing) < prices(A, villas) + prices(A, ordinary_commercial_houses) + prices(A, affordable_housing) && prices(B, villas) + prices(B, ordinary_commercial_houses) + prices(B, affordable_housing) > prices(C, villas) + prices(C, ordinary_commercial_houses) + prices(C, affordable_housing)) ::: (B)
is_unsat(prices(C, villas) + prices(C, ordinary_commercial_houses) + prices(C, affordable_housing) < prices(A, villas) + prices(A, ordinary_commercial_houses) + prices(A, affordable_housing) && prices(C, villas) + prices(C, ordinary_commercial_houses) + prices(C, affordable_housing) < prices(B, villas) + prices(B, ordinary_commercial_houses) + prices(B, affordable_housing)) ::: (C)
is_unsat(prices(A, villas) + prices(A, ordinary_commercial_houses) + prices(A, affordable_housing) < prices(B, villas) + prices(B, ordinary_commercial_houses) + prices(B, affordable_housing) && prices(A, villas) + prices(A, ordinary_commercial_houses) + prices(A, affordable_housing) < prices(C, villas) + prices(C, ordinary_commercial_houses) + prices(C, affordable_housing)) ::: (D)

context: The secret of the 'age' of human male and female ancestors is hidden in the Y chromosome and mitochondria.The Y chromosome only passes from father to son, while mitochondria only pass from mother to daughter.Looking back through these two genetic materials, we can find that all men have a common male ancestor 'Y chromosome Adam', and all women have a common female ancestor 'mitochondrial Eve'.The researchers conducted genome sequencing and comparative analysis of 69 males from nine different populations, such as Asia, Africa, and Latin America, and found that this male common ancestor 'Y chromosome Adam' was formed about 156,000 to 120,000 years ago.Using the same technical analysis of mitochondria, the researchers also calculated that this female common ancestor 'mitochondrial Eve' was formed between 148,000 and 99,000 years ago.
question: Which of the following is most appropriate as a corollary of the above discussion?
options: A.'Y chromosome Adam' and 'mitochondrial Eve' were formed in the same period, and 'age' is close, 'Y chromosome Adam' may be earlier.
B.15 years ago, there was only one man 'Adam' on earth
C.As two individuals, 'Adam' and 'Eve' should never meet
D.Men and women are born together and have conceived modern humans together
raw_logic_programs:
# Declarations
ancestors = EnumSort(['Y chromosome Adam', 'mitochondrial Eve'])
time_periods = EnumSort(['156,000 to 120,000 years ago', '148,000 to 99,000 years ago'])
events = Function([ancestors] -> [time_periods])

# Constraints
events('Y chromosome Adam') == '156,000 to 120,000 years ago' ::: The male common ancestor 'Y chromosome Adam' was formed about 156,000 to 120,000 years ago.
events('mitochondrial Eve') == '148,000 to 99,000 years ago' ::: The female common ancestor 'mitochondrial Eve' was formed between 148,000 and 99,000 years ago.

# Options
Question ::: Which of the following is most appropriate as a corollary of the above discussion?
is_valid(And(events('Y chromosome Adam') == events('mitochondrial Eve'), 'Y chromosome Adam' may be earlier)) ::: (A)
is_invalid('15 years ago, there was only one man Adam on earth') ::: (B)
is_invalid('As two individuals, Adam and Eve should never meet') ::: (C)
is_valid('Men and women are born together and have conceived modern humans together') ::: (D)

context: Research has found that insects 'breathe' through the stomata system on their bodies.The stomata are connected to the trachea, and more and more layers of smaller and smaller air are attached from top to bottom, thereby bringing oxygen to the whole body.At the current level of oxygen in the atmosphere, the total length of the stomata system has reached the limit; if the total length exceeds this limit, the oxygen supply capacity will be insufficient.Therefore, it can be judged that the amount of oxygen content can determine the size of insects.
question: Which of the following, if true, would best support the above argument?
options: A.Studies of invertebrates in the ocean have also found that in colder water and with higher oxygen content, the organisms there are also larger

B.During the Carboniferous period, the concentration of oxygen in the earth 's atmosphere was as high as 35%, much higher than the current 21%.At that time, there were many giant insects on the earth, and the wingspan of the dragonfly was close to one meter.
C.Small locusts cannot survive in a low-oxygen environment, especially in an environment with an oxygen concentration below 15%.Adult locusts can survive in an environment with 2% oxygen
D.Under the environment with high oxygen content and high air pressure, the tested fruit flies lived to the fifth generation and their body size increased by 20%
raw_logic_programs:
# Declarations
insects = EnumSort([insect])
oxygen_levels = EnumSort([low, normal, high])
size = Function([insects] -> [int])

# Constraints
oxygen_content(low) < oxygen_content(normal) ::: Low oxygen levels lead to smaller insect sizes
oxygen_content(normal) < oxygen_content(high) ::: Normal oxygen levels lead to medium insect sizes
ForAll([i:insects], Implies(oxygen_content(high) > oxygen_content(normal), size(i) > size(insect))) ::: Higher oxygen content supports larger insect sizes

# Options
Question ::: Which of the following, if true, would best support the above argument?
is_supportive(oxygen_content(high) > oxygen_content(normal) AND size(insect) > size(insect)) ::: (A)
is_supportive(oxygen_content(35%) > oxygen_content(21%) AND size(insect) > size(insect)) ::: (B)
is_supportive(oxygen_content(low) < oxygen_content(15%) AND size(insect) < size(insect)) ::: (C)
is_supportive(oxygen_content(high) AND size(insect) > size(insect)) ::: (D)

context: Conne Levi with a 'moe' look looks like other newborns.But because it is the world's first test-tube baby screened by next-generation gene sequencing technology, his advent has attracted the attention of experts and scholars.Not long ago, this news detonated the audience at the 'European Society of Human Reproduction and Embryology Annual Meeting' held in London, England.And ordinary people also believe that humans may usher in the era of 'customized babies'.
question: Which of the following, if true, would best refute the views of ordinary people?
options: A.'Artificial' genetic screening does not rule out that there will be loopholes; in natural conception, the guidelines for survival of the fittest in nature seem to be more subtle and effective

B.It can be seen from the development history of modern science and technology that technological development is often faster than human cognition, and sometimes technology will go further and deviate from the track of human cognition

C.Gene screening is mainly to avoid reproductive defects, this technology brings opportunities for human eugenics and eugenics; as for 'customized babies', the concept of cloning is more involved, the two should not be confused

# Constraints
ForAll([v:views], Exists([c:claims], refutes(v) == c)) ::: Each view can be refuted by a claim

# Options

context: The basis of life-the main component of protein is an amino acid molecule.It is an organic molecule.Although people have not directly observed amino acid molecules in cosmic space, scientists have used hydrogen, water, oxygen, methane and formaldehyde in the laboratory to simulate the natural conditions of space.Kinds of amino acids.The raw materials used to synthesize amino acids are abundant in interstellar molecules.It is not difficult to imagine that there must also be amino acid molecules in the universe.As long as there is an appropriate environment, they may be transformed into proteins and further develop into organic life.According to this speculation, there are living bodies on other planets than the earth, and may even be living bodies with higher intelligence.
question: Which of the following is true to best refute the above speculation?
options: A.There is a huge difference between the process of developing from protein to organic life and the process from organic molecules to protein
B.Higher intelligence is not only a product of material evolution, but also a product of continuous socialization
C.In the natural environment, the synthesis of amino acid molecules from existing interstellar molecules is a small probability event
D.Some interstellar molecules are not found in the Earth 's environment, and they are still not available in the laboratory
raw_logic_programs:
# Declarations
speculation = EnumSort([A, B, C, D])
truth_value = EnumSort([true, false])
refutes = Function([speculation] -> [truth_value])

# Constraints
refutes(A) == true ::: There is a huge difference between the process of developing from protein to organic life and the process from organic molecules to protein
refutes(B) == true ::: Higher intelligence is not only a product of material evolution, but also a product of continuous socialization
refutes(C) == true ::: In the natural environment, the synthesis of amino acid molecules from existing interstellar molecules is a small probability event
refutes(D) == true ::: Some interstellar molecules are not found in the Earth's environment, and they are still not available in the laboratory

# Options
Question ::: Which of the following is true to best refute the above speculation?
is_valid(refutes(A) == true) ::: (A)
is_valid(refutes(B) == true) ::: (B)
is_valid(refutes(C) == true) ::: (C)
is_valid(refutes(D) == true) ::: (D)

context: By analyzing the light released or absorbed by the atoms of an object, you can measure whether the object is far away from the earth or close to the earth.When the object is far away from the earth, the frequency of these lights will move to the red end (low frequency) of the spectrum, referred to as 'red shift' 'On the contrary, it is called' blue shift '.The unique light emitted by the atoms is also affected by the mass of the elementary particles that make up the atoms, especially the electrons.If the mass of an atom increases, the energy of the photons it releases will also become higher, so the release and absorption frequencies will be blue-shifted.Conversely, if the particles become lighter and lighter, the frequency will be red-shifted.Astronomical observations have found that most galaxies have a redshift phenomenon.Moreover, the farther the galaxy is from the earth, the greater the redshift.According to this, many scientists believe that the universe must be constantly expanding.
question: Which of the following, if true, can best refute the views of the above scientists?
options: A.In the distant universe, some blue-shifted objects were also found
B.The earth is not in the center of the universe
C.The stars that people can observe may be less than one percent of the real universe
D.From the perspective of other celestial bodies in the universe, redshift is also an absolute dominant phenomenon
raw_logic_programs:
# Declarations
observations = EnumSort([red_shift, blue_shift])
galaxies = EnumSort([galaxy1, galaxy2, galaxy3, ..., galaxyN])  # Representing multiple galaxies
phenomena = Function([galaxies] -> [observations])

# Constraints
ForAll([g:galaxies], phenomena(g) == red_shift) ::: Most galaxies have a redshift phenomenon
ForAll([g1:galaxies, g2:galaxies], Implies(g1 != g2, And(phenomena(g1) == red_shift, phenomena(g2) == red_shift))) ::: The farther the galaxy is from the earth, the greater the redshift

# Options
Question ::: Which of the following, if true, can best refute the views of the above scientists?
is_valid(Exists([g:galaxies], phenomena(g) == blue_shift)) ::: (A) In the distant universe, some blue-shifted objects were also found
is_valid(False) ::: (B) The earth is not in the center of the universe
is_valid(False) ::: (C) The stars that people can observe may be less than one percent of the real universe
is_valid(False) ::: (D) From the perspective of other celestial bodies in the universe, redshift is also an absolute dominant phenomenon

context: A company has a 6-story office building.The company's finance department, planning department, administration department, sales department, human resources department, and research and development department work here, and each department occupies one of the floors.Known? (1) The two floors of the human resources department and the sales department are not adjacent; (2) The finance department is on the next floor of the planning department; (3) The floor of the administrative department is above the planning department, but in the manpower Below the Resources Department.
question: In order from bottom to top, which of the following matches the distribution of the above floors?
options: A.Finance Department, Planning Department, Administration Department, Human Resources Department, R & D Department, Sales Department
B.Finance Department, Planning Department, Administration Department, Human Resources Department, Sales Department, R & D Department
C.Planning Department, Finance Department, Sales Department, R & D Department, Administration Department, Human Resources Department
D.Sales Department, Finance Department, Planning Department, R & D Department, Human Resources Department, Administration Department
raw_logic_programs:
# Declarations
departments = EnumSort([Finance, Planning, Administration, Human_Resources, Sales, R_and_D])
floors = EnumSort([1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6])
occupies = Function([departments] -> [floors])

# Constraints
And(Not(Adjacent(occupies(Human_Resources), occupies(Sales)))) ::: The two floors of the human resources department and the sales department are not adjacent
And(occupies(Finance) == Next(occupies(Planning))) ::: The finance department is on the next floor of the planning department
And(occupies(Administration) > occupies(Planning), occupies(Administration) < occupies(Human_Resources)) ::: The floor of the administrative department is above the planning department, but below the human resources department

# Options
Question ::: In order from bottom to top, which of the following matches the distribution of the above floors?
is_valid(And(occupies(Finance) == 1, occupies(Planning) == 2, occupies(Administration) == 3, occupies(Human_Resources) == 4, occupies(R_and_D) == 5, occupies(Sales) == 6)) ::: (A)
is_valid(And(occupies(Finance) == 1, occupies(Planning) == 2, occupies(Administration) == 3, occupies(Human_Resources) == 4, occupies(Sales) == 5, occupies(R_and_D) == 6)) ::: (B)
is_valid(And(occupies(Planning) == 1, occupies(Finance) == 2, occupies(Sales) == 3, occupies(R_and_D) == 4, occupies(Administration) == 5, occupies(Human_Resources) == 6)) ::: (C)
is_valid(And(occupies(Sales) == 1, occupies(Finance) == 2, occupies(Planning) == 3, occupies(R_and_D) == 4, occupies(Human_Resources) == 5, occupies(Administration) == 6)) ::: (D)

context: With the help of animal fossils and DNA retained in specimens, and using increasingly advanced cloning and genetic techniques, humans have been able to 'resurrect' some already extinct animals, such as mammoths, dodos, dinosaurs, etc.At the same time, the scientific community also started a big discussion about whether humans should revive extinct animals.Supporters believe that reanimated animals are expected to restore the damaged ecological environment in some areas.For example, Mammoths live on the vast grasslands of Siberia, and their excrement is an excellent fertilizer to nourish the grasslands.After the mammoth became extinct, grasslands lacking fertilizer were gradually replaced by tundra.If the mammoth can be resurrected and returned to Siberia, it will help reduce the area of tundra and gradually restore the grassland ecosystem.
question: Which of the following, if true, would best refute the arguments of the above supporters?
options: A.If you invest a lot of time, energy and cost to resurrect the disappeared creatures, it will inevitably contain and weaken the protection of existing endangered animals, and the result will not be worth the loss.
B.Merely cloning an individual of an extinct animal does not mean that humans have the ability to resurrect the entire population

C.Even if the extinct animals can be resurrected in batches, the habitat suitable for their growth may have long since disappeared.If you can not give heavy organisms a suitable environment for survival, all efforts will be in vain
D.The vast majority of these animals gradually disappeared in the course of human development.It was human activities that led to their extinction
raw_logic_programs:
To formulate the problem as a logic program, we will follow the structure of Declarations, Constraints, and Options as outlined in your request.

### Problem:
With the help of animal fossils and DNA retained in specimens, and using increasingly advanced cloning and genetic techniques, humans have been able to 'resurrect' some already extinct animals, such as mammoths, dodos, dinosaurs, etc. At the same time, the scientific community also started a big discussion about whether humans should revive extinct animals. Supporters believe that reanimated animals are expected to restore the damaged ecological environment in some areas. For example, Mammoths live on the vast grasslands of Siberia, and their excrement is an excellent fertilizer to nourish the grasslands. After the mammoth became extinct, grasslands lacking fertilizer were gradually replaced by tundra. If the mammoth can be resurrected and returned to Siberia, it will help reduce the area of tundra and gradually restore the grassland ecosystem.

### Question:
Which of the following, if true, would best refute the arguments of the above supporters?

### Choices:
(A) If you invest a lot of time, energy, and cost to resurrect the disappeared creatures, it will inevitably contain and weaken the protection of existing endangered animals, and the result will not be worth the loss.  
(B) Merely cloning an individual of an extinct animal does not mean that humans have the ability to resurrect the entire population.  
(C) Even if the extinct animals can be resurrected in batches, the habitat suitable for their growth may have long since disappeared. If you cannot give heavy organisms a suitable environment for survival, all efforts will be in vain.  
(D) The vast majority of these animals gradually disappeared in the course of human development. It was human activities that led to their extinction.

### Logic Program

#### Declarations
``` 
arguments = EnumSort([A, B, C, D])
refute = Function([arguments] -> [bool])
```

#### Constraints
```
ForAll([arg:arguments], refute(arg) == true) ::: If an argument is true, it refutes the supporters' claims.
```

#### Options
```
is_valid(refute(A)) ::: (A)
is_valid(refute(B)) ::: (B)
is_valid(refute(C)) ::: (C)
is_valid(refute(D)) ::: (D)
```

### Explanation:
- **Declarations**: We declare the possible arguments (A, B, C, D) that could refute the supporters' claims.
- **Constraints**: We state that if any argument is true, it refutes the claims of the supporters.
- **Options**: We check the validity of each argument in terms of its ability to refute the supporters' claims.

This structure allows us to analyze which argument best refutes the supporters' claims regarding the resurrection of extinct animals.

context: Many pregnant women have symptoms of vitamin deficiency, but this is usually not due to the lack of vitamins in the diet of pregnant women, but because of the growth of babies in the abdomen, they have a higher demand for vitamins than others.
question: Which of the following is most important for evaluating the above conclusion?
options: A.Test the daily diet of some pregnant women who do not lack vitamins to determine the vitamin content.
B.Test pregnant women and other women who have enough vitamins in their daily diet to determine whether they lack vitamins.
C.Test pregnant women and other women with insufficient vitamins in their daily diet and determine whether they are deficient in vitamins.
D.Test the daily diet of some pregnant women who lack vitamins to determine the content of vitamins.
raw_logic_programs:
# Declarations
pregnant_women = EnumSort([woman1, woman2, woman3, woman4, woman5, woman6])  # Representing a sample of pregnant women
other_women = EnumSort([womanA, womanB, womanC, womanD, womanE, womanF])  # Representing a sample of non-pregnant women
vitamin_content = Function([pregnant_women] -> [int])  # Function to represent vitamin content in the diet
vitamin_deficiency = Function([pregnant_women] -> [bool])  # Function to represent whether a woman is vitamin deficient

# Constraints
ForAll([pw:pregnant_women], vitamin_deficiency(pw) == (vitamin_content(pw) < required_vitamin_level))  # Pregnant women are deficient if their vitamin content is below a required level
ForAll([ow:other_women], vitamin_deficiency(ow) == (vitamin_content(ow) < required_vitamin_level))  # Non-pregnant women are deficient if their vitamin content is below a required level

# Options
Question ::: Which of the following is most important for evaluating the above conclusion?
is_valid(Exists([pw:pregnant_women], vitamin_content(pw) >= sufficient_vitamin_level) && ForAll([ow:other_women], vitamin_content(ow) >= sufficient_vitamin_level)) ::: (A)
is_valid(Exists([pw:pregnant_women], vitamin_content(pw) >= sufficient_vitamin_level) && Exists([ow:other_women], vitamin_content(ow) >= sufficient_vitamin_level)) ::: (B)
is_valid(Exists([pw:pregnant_women], vitamin_content(pw) < insufficient_vitamin_level) && Exists([ow:other_women], vitamin_content(ow) < insufficient_vitamin_level)) ::: (C)
is_valid(Exists([pw:pregnant_women], vitamin_content(pw) < insufficient_vitamin_level)) ::: (D)

context: A survey of traffic accidents has found that the incidence of traffic accidents is actually similar in cities where drunk driving is strictly investigated and those who do not.However, most experts believe that strict investigation of drunk driving can indeed reduce the occurrence of traffic accidents.
question: Which of the following is most helpful in eliminating this inconsistency?
options: A.Severe investigations of drunk driving have occurred in urban traffic accidents.
B.The city that implements strict investigation of drunk driving has not eliminated drunk driving.
C.It is more important to improve drivers' traffic safety awareness than strict management.
D.In addition to strict investigation of drunk driving, other traffic violations should also be stopped.
raw_logic_programs:
# Declarations
cities = EnumSort([CityA, CityB])  # Example cities where the study is conducted
investigation_strictness = EnumSort([strict, lenient])
accident_incidence = Function([cities] -> [bool])  # Indicates if the incidence of accidents is similar
drunk_driving_investigation = Function([cities] -> [investigation_strictness])  # Type of investigation in each city

# Constraints
ForAll([c:cities], accident_incidence(c) == (drunk_driving_investigation(c) == strict)) ::: The incidence of traffic accidents is similar in cities with strict and lenient investigations
ForAll([c:cities], Implies(drunk_driving_investigation(c) == strict, Not(accident_incidence(c)))) ::: Strict investigation can reduce the occurrence of traffic accidents

# Options
Question ::: Which of the following is most helpful in eliminating this inconsistency?
is_helpful(Exists([c:cities], And(drunk_driving_investigation(c) == strict, accident_incidence(c) == false))) ::: (A) Severe investigations of drunk driving have occurred in urban traffic accidents.
is_helpful(Exists([c:cities], And(drunk_driving_investigation(c) == strict, Not(drunk_driving_investigation(c) == lenient)))) ::: (B) The city that implements strict investigation of drunk driving has not eliminated drunk driving.
is_helpful(Exists([c:cities], And(drunk_driving_investigation(c) == strict, Not(accident_incidence(c))))) ::: (C) It is more important to improve drivers' traffic safety awareness than strict management.
is_helpful(Exists([c:cities], And(drunk_driving_investigation(c) == strict, Not(accident_incidence(c))))) ::: (D) In addition to strict investigation of drunk driving, other traffic violations should also be stopped.

context: With the rapid development of the Internet, it has become a reality to buy your favorite products without leaving home.Even in countries and regions with low economic development levels, people can satisfy their pursuit of material life through online shopping.
question: Which of the following can most question the above view?
options: A.As online shopping sales increase, related taxes and fees will also increase.
B.Even in the era when there is no Internet, people can still buy their favorite products through physical stores.
C.The display of goods on the Internet cannot fully reflect the real situation.
D.People's satisfaction with the pursuit of material life depends only on the level of economic development in the region.
raw_logic_programs:
# Declarations
views = EnumSort([A, B, C, D])
question = Function([views] -> [bool])

# Constraints
# The view is that online shopping allows people to satisfy their pursuit of material life.
# We need to identify which statement can most question this view.
# A: Online shopping sales increase, related taxes and fees will also increase.
# B: Even in the era when there is no Internet, people can still buy their favorite products through physical stores.
# C: The display of goods on the Internet cannot fully reflect the real situation.
# D: People's satisfaction with the pursuit of material life depends only on the level of economic development in the region.

# Options
# Question: Which of the following can most question the above view?
is_valid(question(A) == false) ::: (A)  # A does not question the view, it supports the idea of online shopping.
is_valid(question(B) == true) ::: (B)  # B questions the view by stating that physical stores existed before the Internet.
is_valid(question(C) == true) ::: (C)  # C questions the view by stating that online displays may not reflect reality.
is_valid(question(D) == true) ::: (D)  # D questions the view by suggesting that satisfaction is solely dependent on economic development.

question: Which of the following can guarantee the correctness of the above statement?
options: A.Unless it is a university teacher, it is impossible to have a doctorate from a prestigious school and have more than one year of research experience in an overseas research institution.
B.In recent years, college teachers have required overseas research experience.
C.Some middle school teachers also have doctorate degrees and overseas research experience.
D.Unless they are PhDs and have more than one year of overseas research experience, they cannot become university teachers.
raw_logic_programs:
# Declarations
individuals = EnumSort([Wang_Gang])
qualifications = EnumSort([doctorate, research_experience])
roles = EnumSort([university_teacher, middle_school_teacher])
has = Function([individuals, qualifications] -> [bool])
is = Function([individuals] -> [roles])

# Constraints
has(Wang_Gang, doctorate) ::: Wang Gang has a doctorate from a prestigious school
has(Wang_Gang, research_experience) ::: Wang Gang has more than one year of research experience in a research institution overseas
is(Wang_Gang) == university_teacher ::: Wang Gang must be a university teacher

# Options
Question ::: Which of the following can guarantee the correctness of the above statement?
is_valid(Implies(Not(is(Wang_Gang) == university_teacher), And(has(Wang_Gang, doctorate), has(Wang_Gang, research_experience)))) ::: (A)
is_valid(Implies(is(Wang_Gang) == university_teacher, has(Wang_Gang, research_experience))) ::: (B)
is_valid(Exists([x:individuals], And(is(x) == middle_school_teacher, has(x, doctorate), has(x, research_experience)))) ::: (C)
is_valid(Implies(Not(And(has(Wang_Gang, doctorate), has(Wang_Gang, research_experience))), Not(is(Wang_Gang) == university_teacher))) ::: (D)

context: If Malaysia Airlines 'passenger plane did not malfunction and was not hijacked by terrorist organizations, it must have been shot down by a missile.If the passenger plane is shot down by a missile, it will be discovered by the satellite; if the satellite finds that the passenger plane is shot down by the missile, it will be announced to the media.
question: If you want to get the conclusion that the plane was hijacked by a terrorist organization, which of the following should be added?
options: A.The passenger plane was not shot down by the missile.
B.There were no reports of missiles shooting down the passenger plane, and the passenger plane did not malfunction.
C.The passenger plane did not malfunction.
D.The passenger plane malfunctioned and no missiles shot down the passenger plane.
raw_logic_programs:
# Declarations
events = EnumSort([malfunction, hijacked, shot_down, discovered, announced])
conditions = Function([events] -> [bool])

# Constraints
Implies(Not(conditions(malfunction)), Not(conditions(hijacked))) ::: If the passenger plane did not malfunction, it was not hijacked
Implies(Not(conditions(hijacked)), conditions(shot_down)) ::: If the passenger plane was not hijacked, it must have been shot down by a missile
Implies(conditions(shot_down), conditions(discovered)) ::: If the passenger plane is shot down by a missile, it will be discovered by the satellite
Implies(conditions(discovered), conditions(announced)) ::: If the satellite finds that the passenger plane is shot down by a missile, it will be announced to the media

# Options
Question ::: If you want to get the conclusion that the plane was hijacked by a terrorist organization, which of the following should be added?
is_valid(conditions(shot_down) == false) ::: (A) The passenger plane was not shot down by the missile.
is_valid(And(Not(conditions(shot_down)), Not(conditions(malfunction)))) ::: (B) There were no reports of missiles shooting down the passenger plane, and the passenger plane did not malfunction.
is_valid(conditions(malfunction) == false) ::: (C) The passenger plane did not malfunction.
is_valid(And(conditions(malfunction), Not(conditions(shot_down)))) ::: (D) The passenger plane malfunctioned and no missiles shot down the passenger plane.

context: Making more money makes people happier, at least to some extent.But new research shows that the reverse is also true, and happy people can make more money.Researchers at the University of London, after researching more than 10,000 Americans, found that those with positive emotions who are more satisfied with life as they grow up have higher incomes when they reach the age of 29.
question: Which of the following can best question the above research conclusions?
options: A.Most of the young people who grew up in wealthier families have a negative attitude towards life.
B.In addition to emotions, the degree of specialization and work ability will directly affect the income level.
C.Most young people who are more satisfied with their lives are born in wealthier families, and all have a good professional background.
D.It should compare the occupational distribution of the respondents.
raw_logic_programs:
# Declarations
variables = EnumSort([income, happiness, satisfaction, age])
people = EnumSort([individual_1, individual_2, ..., individual_10000])  # Representing the 10,000 Americans studied
research = Function([people] -> [bool])  # Function to represent the research conclusions

# Constraints
ForAll([p:people], Implies(happiness(p) == positive, income(p) > threshold)) ::: Happy people can make more money
ForAll([p:people], Implies(satisfaction(p) == high, income(p) > threshold)) ::: Those with positive emotions and high satisfaction have higher incomes at age 29
ForAll([p:people], age(p) == 29) ::: The study focuses on individuals at the age of 29

# Options
Question ::: Which of the following can best question the above research conclusions?
is_valid(Exists([p:people], And(income(p) < threshold, happiness(p) == negative))) ::: (A)
is_valid(Exists([p:people], And(income(p) < threshold, specialization(p) == low))) ::: (B)
is_valid(Exists([p:people], And(income(p) < threshold, satisfaction(p) == high, background(p) == wealthy))) ::: (C)
is_valid(Exists([p:people], And(occupation_distribution(p) == skewed))) ::: (D)

context: Teacher Zhang said? This time, all the students in our class have passed the examination.Therefore, none of the students in our class have passed.
question: Which of the following is most similar to the above reasoning?
options: A.All the students who passed the bottom-up exam passed the review, so all the students who passed the review passed.
B.All the students who failed the bottom-up exam did not review well, so the students who did not review well did not pass.

C.All the students who have participated in the bottom-up examination have been carefully prepared.Therefore, the students who have not taken the bottom-up examination have not been carefully prepared.
D.All heroes can stand the test, so those who cannot stand the test are not heroes.
raw_logic_programs:
# Declarations
students = EnumSort([Student1, Student2, Student3, ..., StudentN])  # Represents all students in the class
passed_exam = Function([students] -> [bool])  # Function to determine if a student passed the exam

# Constraints
ForAll([s:students], passed_exam(s) == true) ::: All students in the class have passed the examination
ForAll([s:students], passed_exam(s) == false) ::: None of the students in the class have passed

# Options
Question ::: Which of the following is most similar to the above reasoning?
is_similar(And(passed_exam(Student1) == true, passed_exam(Student1) == false)) ::: (A)  # Contradictory reasoning
is_similar(And(passed_exam(Student2) == false, Not(passed_exam(Student2) == true))) ::: (B)  # Contradictory reasoning
is_similar(And(passed_exam(Student3) == false, Not(passed_exam(Student3) == true))) ::: (C)  # Contradictory reasoning
is_similar(And(passed_exam(Student4) == false, Not(passed_exam(Student4) == true))) ::: (D)  # Contradictory reasoning

# Note: The reasoning in the original problem is contradictory, and the options should reflect similar contradictions.

# Constraints
food_prices_increase > 0  # Food prices have increased
food_purchases_percentage > 0  # Food purchases account for a percentage of income
average_income_increase == True  # Average income has increased

# Options
